intro: Acaena glandulifera subsp. nordenskjoeldii, commonly known as the Northern bristleberry, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its densely hairy stems and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in forest understories and is known for its ornamental value and ecological importance.
